data.title: Obituary for Warren Richard Campbell

data.meta_description:
Warren Richard Campbell, 78, passed away on Thursday, September 23, 2010, at his home in Winona Lake, Indiana.
He was born...
data.text:
Warren Richard Campbell, 78, passed away on Thursday, September 23, 2010, at his home in Winona Lake, Indiana.

He was born on August 1, 1932, in South Bend, Indiana, to Roy and Mary (Piety) Campbell. Warren graduated from Greene Township High School in 1951.

He served in the Air Force during the Korean War and was stationed in California and Germany.

In 1957 he married Annelies Krause in Kaufbeuren, Germany. He received his bachelor's and master's degrees in education from Ball State University. He was an educator in Ohio and Indiana and in 1996 retired from the Indiana State Employment Office. During his retirement years he worked part-time for Enterprise Car Rental Company.

Warren was a lifetime member of the Warsaw Church of Christ and served as an elder. He was involved in several organizations including the Warsaw Lion's Club.

He enjoyed music, traveling, gardening, camping and spending time with his grandchildren.

He was preceded in death by his parents; his sister, Thelma (Campbell) Hoggatt; and his brothers-in-law, Georg Schon, Josel Krause and Corbin Bolinger.

He is survived by his wife, Annelies Campbell; and three daughters, Yvonne (and spouse Andy) Strack and their children Andrew, Christian, Anthony and Evan of Kendallville, Ind.; Ingrid Campbell and son Jackson Burnett of Shawnee, Kan.; Heidi (and spouse Eric Younger) Campbell and their sons Kai and Zachary of Ketchum, Idaho; and his sister, Marilyn Bolinger of South Bend. He is also survived by his brother-in-law, Dean Hoggatt of LaGrange, Ind., and sisters-in-law, Traudel Schon and Marie Krause of Germany

A memorial service will be held on Sunday, September 26, at 3 p.m. at the Warsaw Church of Christ located at the corner of Lincoln and Main streets in Warsaw, Ind.

Memorials may be made to the K21 Foundation for Kosciusko County Cancer Fund, P.O. Box 1810, Warsaw, IN 46581 or the Shults-Lewis Child and Family Services, P.O. Box 471, Valparaiso, IN 46383.

Arrangements by Northern Indiana Funeral Care of Kendallville and Fort Wayne. 877-382-2756

Send a condolence to the family at www.hitefuneralhome.com or www.northernindianafuneralcare.com
